newsitem.title: SRI LANKA: PRESS DIGEST - Sri Lanka Newspapers - September 3.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Sri Lanka Newspapers - September 3.

text.p: Following are some of the main stories in Tuesday's Sri Lankan newspapers.
President Chandrika Kumaratunga seeks UNDP (United Nations Development Programme) to rebuild Jaffna, former Tamil rebel stronghold.
Interpol on alert for Sri Lankan Tamil Tiger rebels' heroin smuggling.
Nurses threaten to strike if government does not solve outstanding salary anomalies.
Sri Lanka police celebrates 130 years of service.
Separatist Liberation Tigers of Tamil Eelam recruit 500 minors by force.
Moslems in the east call for their own autonomous regions as government discusses its devolution proposals.
Government launches semi-luxury bus service for office commuters.
Minority Tamil detainees in two prisons go on hunger strike demanding they be brought before courts or released.
Police recover grenades and guns from southern Colombo suburb.
